results.title: Europe by train
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Douglas Brown, journalist and traveller, takes us about Europe telling of his experiences of many different countries: Italy, Switzerland, Germany and Spain. Lingering in stations, or riding on some crack continental expresses, he conveys the excitment of travelling abroad and shows how he makes the journey an interesting part of a holiday or a business trip.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: Europa nostra
results.creator_credit: Charles Mapleston, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Shot in fifteen countries in Western and Eastern Europe, this film touches upon all aspects of conservation, including: treasures lost, restoration, new uses for old buildings, traffic, pressures of tourism, unsightly advertising, and the activities of local authorities and conservation authorities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Mapleston, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures

results.title: Europa
results.brief_description: Animated film giving thumb-nail description of the history of Europe. It then switches to a summary of the federation movement in the United States and its advantages. Concludes by pointing to potential future advantages of a European Community movement.
results.description: Animated film giving thumb-nail description of the history of Europe. It then switches to a summary of the federation movement in the United States and its advantages. Concludes by pointing to potential future advantages of a European Community movement.

results.title: Eulogy For A Black Mass

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: Aria Dean explores the black creative labour put into memes, images defined not by their content but by how they are circulated, mutated and compressed - International Film Festival Rotterdam
description_for_label: Aria Dean explores the black creative labour put into memes, images defined not by their content but by how they are circulated, mutated and compressed - International Film Festival Rotterdam
